description: President Joe Biden took the US crackdown on what American officials say are unfair trade practices employed by China a step further in early May. After a review of the increased tariffs his predecessor, Donald Trump, imposed on Chinese imports, the Biden administration said it would maintain those and add more of its own. Both administrations have justified the moves by saying China’s industrial and trade policies put US competitors at a disadvantage.
title: Why Biden Is Doubling Down on Trump’s China Tariffs

description: The world’s three dominant economies are entering a combative phase that threatens to deepen fractures and challenges decades of free-market orthodoxy as the US uses trade weapons borrowed from China’s playbook, leaving Europe at a critical crossroads.
title: A New Trade War Offers No Easy Way Back for Old Global Order

description: Canada’s government says it will spend more on debt costs this year as it updates its forecasts to reflect a higher-than-expected outlook for interest rates.
title: Canada to Spend More on Debt After Rate Forecasts Edge Higher

description: Keir Starmer will pitch for votes in Scotland at a campaign event Friday that will see the Labour leader try to take advantage of turmoil in the Scottish National Party to cement his path to power at the UK election.
title: Labour’s Starmer Pitches for Scottish Votes on Path to UK Power

description: Prominent technology and finance industry leaders descended on Washington for a state dinner honoring President William Ruto of Kenya, a lavish and glitzy affair to spotlight President Joe Biden’s efforts to strengthen US economic ties with Africa and counter Chinese and Russian influence across the continent.
title: Lobster and Country Music: Biden, Tech Chiefs Fete Kenya’s Ruto

description: Mexico’s finance minister downplayed the idea of a major reworking of the state oil company’s debt in the near future, saying no “large operations” are currently planned.
title: Pemex's Big Debt Moves Are Far From Imminent, Finance Minister Says

description: Many of Nikki Haley’s donors will vote for Donald Trump but won’t financially contribute to his campaign, said New Hampshire Governor Chris Sununu.
title: Haley Donors Will Vote But Not Give to Trump, GOP’s Sununu Says

description: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will attend June’s meeting of Group of 7 leaders, people familiar with the matter said, as he pushes countries for longer-range weapons that will allow his forces to attack Russia inside its borders.
title: Zelenskiy Set to Attend G7 Leaders Meeting in Fresh Push for Aid

description: Demonstrations are expected across Taiwan Friday in protest against a push by opposition lawmakers to pass a bill that would expand their powers and limit new President Lai Ching-te’s ability to govern in the most dangerous flashpoint in US-China ties.
title: Why Protesters in Taiwan Are Angry With Lawmakers

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Saleha Mohsin and producer Julia Press outline for the Big Take DC podcast the looming battle over taxes next year. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: A Big Tax Fight Awaits After the Presidential Election Is Settled

description: Donald Trump raised $40 million from oil executives and other deep-pocketed donors in Texas, marking Wednesday’s haul as one of the most profitable days for the presumptive Republican nominee seeking to close a fundraising gap with President Joe Biden.
title: Oil Executives Fuel Trump’s $40 Million Texas Fundraising Haul

description: The US Justice Department’s lawsuit accusing the owner of Live Nation and Ticketmaster of operating an illegal monopoly was just the latest of a series of US antitrust cases brought against major American corporations in recent years. The department has also filed antitrust suits against Apple Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google (twice), and the Federal Trade Commission is suing Amazon.com Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc., owner of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp.
title: The US Antitrust Crusade: A Brief Overview of Cases Against Live Nation, Big Tech

description: Louisiana plans to reclassify the two main US abortion pills as controlled substances, making it a crime to possess mifepristone or misoprostol without a prescription in a state that already has a near-total ban on ending unwanted pregnancies.
title: Louisiana Plans to Criminalize Possession of Abortion Pills

description: The president of Northwestern University, responding to questions about foreign funding sources at a congressional hearing, said the school is reviewing a contract with Qatar for its journalism-focused campus there.
title: Northwestern Says It’s Reviewing Contract for Campus in Qatar

description: President Joe Biden is nominating US National Labor Relations Board Chair Lauren McFerran for a new five-year term, moving to lock in the Democrat ahead of the 2024 election.
title: Biden Moves to Extend Labor Board Chief as He Courts Unions

description: A British trade official called on Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government to ratify the UK’s entry into a Pacific trade deal by the end of the year, despite opposition from some Canadian agriculture groups.
title: UK Urges Canada to Ratify Its Entry Into Pacific Trade Pact

description: President Joe Biden defended his decision against sending US troops to Haiti, while saying he was confident the deployment of a multinational police force led by Kenya could break the cycle of violence that has gripped the country.
title: Biden Says He Kept US Troops Out of Haiti to Avoid Misperception

description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy slammed Amtrak over a system failure that caused “an unmitigated disaster” resulting in delays for thousands of commuters in his state and the New York area during the evening rush hour Wednesday.
title: NJ Governor Blasts Amtrak Over ‘Unmitigated Disaster’ in Rush Hour Commute

description: The assailant charged with shooting Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said he acted out of frustration with the government’s policies, above all the premier’s decision to halt military support for Ukraine, a court document said.
title: Slovak Premier’s Shooter Opposed Ukraine Policy, Court Document Shows

description: President Joe Biden will likely miss a Ukraine peace summit next month because it conflicts with a campaign fundraiser in California he’s set to attend alongside George Clooney, Julia Roberts and other stars.
title: Biden Set to Skip Ukraine Peace Summit for Hollywood Fundraiser

description: Most investors expect South Africa’s ruling African National Congress to form a stable coalition that includes the Inkatha Freedom Party after May 29 elections, boosting financial markets and ensuring policy stability, according to research group Krutham.
title: South Africa Investors See Stable Coalition After Election

description: Before India’s marathon election kicked off in April, Prime Minister Narendra Modi was promising to come back to power with an even bigger majority than he won five years ago.
title: Modi’s 400-Seat Dream In Doubt as India Opposition Gains Steam

description: In the City of London, executives are looking forward to the imminent general election as a chance for clarity after a turbulent few years.
title: City of London Is Relaxed About the Prospect of a Labour Election Win

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he would postpone a change in voting rules in the French territory of New Caledonia to give parties time to negotiate a new agreement.
title: Macron Postpones Change in Voting Rules in New Caledonia

description: Israel will expand its military operation against Hamas in Rafah, saying 1 million civilians have moved out of the southern Gaza city.
title: Israel to Expand Rafah Campaign After 1 Million Civilians Moved

description: Greek and Polish leaders asked European Commission President Ursula Von der Leyen to lead a charge to create a common air defense shield that would be financed by the bloc.
title: Greece and Poland Ask EU to Create a Common Air Defense Shield

description: The US Supreme Court upheld a Republican-drawn congressional map in South Carolina, rejecting claims of racial gerrymandering and boosting the GOP in the fight to control the House for the rest of the decade.
title: Supreme Court Backs GOP-Drawn South Carolina Congressional Map

description: The UK charged a 64-year-old man with a Russia-related breach of its National Security Act.
title: UK Charges a Man With Russia-Related National Security Breaches

description: Gene Block is about to be hit every which way.
title: ‘Zionists Not Welcome’ and Mob Violence Ignite Backlash at UCLA

description: The White House plans to withdraw its nominee for a top trade job after running into opposition from a key Senate Democrat over his support for free trade deals.
title: Biden to Name Deputy Trade Nominee to State Department Role

description: President Vladimir Putin ordered the government to prepare retaliation for any seizure of assets by the US as Washington tries to build support for using revenue from frozen Russia funds to support Ukraine.
title: Putin Allows US Assets in Russia to Be Seized for Retaliation

description: The Identity and Democracy alliance, a pan-European group of far-right parties, has moved to expel Alternative for Germany, according to the DPA news agency, in a move that will add to the German party’s troubles.
title: European Far-Right Moves to Expel German Party After ‘Nazi’ Row

description: China rejected UK accusations it is working to provide Russia with combat equipment in Ukraine, something that could represent an escalation in Beijing’s military support for Moscow.
title: China Condemns UK Claims It’s Giving Russia Combat Gear

description: The European Union extended its legal procedure against Hungary over a controversial “sovereignty-protection” law after Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government failed to alleviate concerns that the legislation may be used to undermine democracy.
title: Hungary Fails to Alleviate EU Concerns About Sovereignty Agency

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: The Countdown Begins: Election Campaign Kicks Off With Focus on Economy

description: Former Bank of England policy maker Michael Saunders said the prospects of an interest rate cut in June are dead for now but that markets are probably under-pricing the chances of a reductions later in the year.
title: UK Election Kills Chance of June Rate Cut, Ex-BOE Official Says

description: Polish authorities are stepping up security around the main transit hub for foreign military aid to Ukraine as a series of arrests announced this week lay bare mounting concerns over Russian-backed sabotage operations.
title: Poland Tightens Ukraine Aid Hub Security Over Sabotage Concerns

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen reiterated that currency intervention should be a seldom-used tool that officials give fair warning about when they resort to it.
title: Yellen Wants Currency Intervention to Be Rare and Well Flagged

description: Russian forces hit Kharkiv and the nearby town of Lyubotyn with a barrage of at least 15 simultaneous missile strikes on Thursday, stepping up pressure against Ukraine’s second-largest city.
title: Russia Hits Kharkiv With Missile Strikes, Killing at Least Six

description: Miguel Galuccio knows shale.
title: Oil Driller’s 1,400% World-Beating Rally Hinges On Milei Reforms

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Sunak’s Early UK Election Is Labour’s to Lose

description: Estonia accused Russian border authorities of removing buoys on the Narva River that separate the two countries’ territories.
title: Estonia Says Russia Removed Narva River Buoys Marking Border

description: The Group of Seven countries are converging on a US plan to squeeze value out of frozen Russian assets, a move that would secure as much as $50 billion in critical financing for Ukraine and help shield it from political shifts on both sides of the Atlantic.
title: G-7 Is Closing In on US-Led Push to Tap Frozen Russian Assets

description: Russia detained a deputy to army chief Valery Gerasimov on corruption allegations, the latest in a series of cases against Defense Ministry officials as the war in Ukraine continues.
title: Russia Detains Deputy to Army Chief in Bribery Investigation

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said it’s critical for the US and Europe to present a clear and united front against Chinese industrial overcapacity, as she warned of the global impact of Beijing’s macroeconomic imbalances.
title: Yellen Calls for United Front on Chinese Industrial Overcapacity

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen criticized Israel for saying it will hold back revenues collected on behalf of the Palestinian Authority, and warned it against cutting Palestinian lenders off from their Israeli correspondent banks.
title: Yellen Criticizes Israel’s Move to Withhold Palestinian Revenues

description: Group of Seven countries are at odds over how to tax the world’s richest individuals as finance officials prepare to gather for a meeting in Stresa, Italy.
title: Billionaire Tax Splits G-7 as Yellen Opposes Push by Le Maire

description: Rishi Sunak said no flights deporting asylum seekers to Rwanda will take off before the general election on July 4, an early setback for the premier’s campaign as he tries to extend his Tories’ 14 years in power.
title: Sunak Says Rwanda Flights Won’t Take Off Before UK Election

description: Net migration to the UK fell last year, a boost for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak as he puts cracking down on overseas arrivals at the heart of the Conservative campaign for the July 4 general election.
title: Migration to UK Falls From Record in Election Boost for Sunak

description: Israel said it would revive stalled cease-fire talks with Hamas after social media video showing female Israeli soldiers being abducted by the militants on Oct. 7 sparked a public outcry.
title: Israel to Restart Gaza Talks After Hostage Video Sparks Outrage

description: Nigel Farage has announced he is not standing as a Reform UK candidate in the July 4 General Election, but will "do my bit to help" the party in the campaign.
title: Nigel Farage Announces He Will Not Be Standing in the General Election

description: Analyzing the economic impact of anti-competitive behaviors.
title: How a DOJ Economist Approaches Antitrust in America

description: Norway will further restrict its entry conditions for Russian tourists from May 29, a decision the government said backed its allies’ reactions to the war being waged in Ukraine.
title: Norway to Tighten Entry Rules for Russian Travelers Next Week

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said his Bharatiya Janata Party has already won a majority of the seats contested in the parliamentary elections due to end next week, putting him in a position to return to office for a third term.
title: Modi Says His Party Already Crossed Majority as Voting Nears End

description: China, Japan and South Korea are set to hold their first summit in about five years with top officials gathering in Seoul next week for talks to improve ties among the economically powerful neighbors.
title: China, Japan and South Korea to Hold Their First Summit Since 2019

description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court accepted a petition by a group of senators seeking to remove Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin on ethical grounds but allowed the premier to perform his duties until it ruled on the case.
title: Thai Court Will Rule on Petition to Dismiss Prime Minister

description: The Aland Islands are variously described as the lock to Finland, a pistol pointed at Sweden, and a beacon of peace.
title: Will ‘Finland’s Achilles Heel’ Become a Problem for Europe?

description: Local leaders say a UAE-backed development will bring modern high-rise offices and apartments that tower over one of Europe’s grandest capitals.
title: Orban’s Vision for Budapest Raises Fears Over a Historic Skyline

description: An American president will host a state visit for an African leader for the first time in 16 years, as the world’s biggest economy struggles to build influence on a continent forging closer relations beyond Washington’s top competitors China and Russia.
title: Kenya President Ruto Visits White House in First African State Visit in 16 Years

description: The trial of exiled Chinese billionaire Guo Wengui began this week in New York, where he’s accused of swindling more than $1 billion from investors in a complex fraud scheme that netted him luxuries including a $26 million New Jersey mansion and a $37 million yacht.
title: Chinese Tycoon Faces US Trial Over $1 Billion Investor Swindle

description: Infighting among some of Europe’s largest far-right parties has thrown pre-election campaigning into turmoil, threatening to spoil a parliamentary vote that was supposed to see ultra-conservative groups win major gains.
title: Europe’s Far Right in Disarray Two Weeks Ahead of Elections

description: South African’s financial markets are brimming with optimism as voters get ready to cast their ballot.
title: South African Assets Primed for Post-Election Rally, but Old Challenges Persist

description: SAN PEDRO GARZA GARCIA, Mexico (AP) — A strong gust of wind toppled the stage at a campaign rally Wednesday evening in the northern Mexican state of Nuevo Leon, killing at least nine people — including a child — and injuring 63, the state's governor said.
title: Stage Collapses at Mexico Campaign Event, Killing at Least Nine

description: Gusts of wind brought down the stage at a campaign event for Mexican presidential candidate Jorge Alvarez Maynez’s Movimiento Ciudadano party, killing at least five people.
title: Stage Collapses at Mexico Campaign Event, Killing at Least Five

description: Disruptions to these critical waterways could upend maritime commerce and rekindle inflation.
title: The Six Choke Points That Can Upend Global Trade

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim defended his continued engagement with Hamas, saying his decades-long ties with the Palestinian Islamist group gave him an edge in attempts to broker for peace in the Middle East.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar Says Hamas Sees Him as Friend Amid Peace Talks

description: French President Emmanuel Macron touched down in New Caledonia early Thursday and called for a “return to peace, calm and security” after days of violent protests in the Pacific territory sparked by a proposed change to the voting franchise.
title: France’s Macron Touches Down in New Caledonia, Urges Calm

description: For seven hours at a Geneva hotel earlier this month, top US and Chinese officials locked into talks on collectively managing their biggest fears around artificial intelligence — while keeping up a cutthroat competition to dominate technology that promises to reshape the global economy.
title: Seven Hours in Geneva Hotel Highlight US-China Struggle on AI

description: China held its biggest military drills in a year around Taiwan, just days after Lai Ching-te took over as the island’s new president.
title: China Holds Biggest Military Drills in a Year Around Taiwan

description: As the Nellai Express Train stopped at Tambaram railway station in southern India at 8:30 p.m. on April 6, six government officials waiting in the shadows behind the steel pillars on the platform rushed into the coach marked A1.
title: Cash-Filled Suitcases Fuel India’s $16 Billion Election
